dt: {bc}the place at which one thing borders on or {d_link|abuts|abut} another

dt.t: Once it chanced that I stood in the very {wi}abutment{/wi} of a rainbow's arch, which filled the lower stratum of the atmosphere, tinging the grass and leaves around, and dazzling me as if I looked through colored crystal.

dt: {bc}the part of a structure (such as an arch or a bridge) that directly receives thrust or pressure
{bc}a tooth or part of a dental implant to which a prosthetic appliance (such as a bridge or artificial crown) is attached for support

dt.t: A dental bridge, like a highway bridge … is supported by {wi}abutments{/wi}, sound teeth on either side of the empty gap.

aq.source: {it}Mount Sinai Medical Center Family Guide to Dental Health{/it}

shortdef: the place at which one thing borders on or abuts another
the part of a structure (such as an arch or a bridge) that directly receives thrust or pressure
a tooth or part of a dental implant to which a prosthetic appliance (such as a bridge or artificial crown) is attached for support
